questions.Title: Right against discrimination
questions.Problem: Which of the following is an example of discrimination?
questions.Option1: a) Helping a friend who is in need
questions.Option2: b) Not inviting someone to a party because of their skin color
questions.Answer: b) Not inviting someone to a party because of their skin color

questions.Title: Right against discrimination
questions.Problem: What can you do to stand up against discrimination?
questions.Option1: a) Join in and make fun of someone different from you
questions.Option2: b) Speak up and tell a teacher or adult if you see someone being treated unfairly
questions.Option3: c) Ignore the situation and pretend you didn't see anything
questions.Answer: b) Speak up and tell a teacher or adult if you see someone being treated unfairly

questions.Title: Right against discrimination
questions.Problem: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.Option1: a) It's okay to judge someone based on their appearance
questions.Option2: b) Everyone should be treated with respect and kindness
questions.Option3: c) Discrimination is only wrong when adults do it.
questions.Answer: b) Everyone should be treated with respect and kindness

questions.Title: Right against discrimination
questions.Problem: Why is it important to treat everyone equally?
questions.Option2: b) Because it's the right thing to do, and it makes the world a better place
questions.Option3: c) Because it doesn't matter how you treat people
questions.Answer: b) Because it's the right thing to do, and it makes the world a better place
